intro: Corallocarpus pseudogijef, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a rare and enigmatic plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lacy fronds that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures are concealed within specialized spore capsules, which are protected by a thick, waxy layer. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, Corallocarpus pseudogijef remains a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
